mismatches.missing: No GitHubInput and Output schema blocks in LLM CFG
mismatches.extra: GithubCommentBlockExample label appears in LLM CFG only

classes_and_functions.nested_consistency: Functions are nested inside the same class in both CFGs

similarities: Identical labels for functions such as __init__, post_comment, create_issue

divergence.LLM: Has additional block splitting in case when issue_url contains 'pull'
divergence.static: Simpler single block with potential conditional content

matches: Basic successor relations are similar in most cases without complex control transitions
differences: Complex conditionals and loops tend to have more explicit successors connections in static CFG while LLM CFG is not detailed

missing_edges.comment: LLM CFG does not cover possibility of no 'pull' in URL leading to fewer explicit successors

other_observations: LLM-based CFG lines tend to be more granular with some lines not translating to separate blocks in the static CFG.
Static CFG includes detailed schema fields for Input and Output classes not mirrored in LLM CFG.
